intro: Arabis tenuirostris, commonly known as narrow-beak rockcress, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with distinctive four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and is often found in alpine environments. Its narrow, elongated leaves and small white or yellow flowers make it a distinctive species in its habitat. Arabis tenuirostris is often used in rock gardens due to its hardy nature and ornamental appeal.
